title: You Have to Grow Wefts to Fold Them
authors: Lauren Niu, Genevi\`eve Dion, Randall D. Kamien
abstract:
Knitting turns a one dimensional yarn into a highly ramified
three-dimensional structure. As a method of additive manufacturing, it holds
promise for a new class of lightweight, ultrastrong materials. Here we present
a purely geometric model to predict the three-dimensional folding of knitted
fabrics made only of the two traditional stitches, knit and purl.
